metadata.title: RBI Grade B - PIB Press Releases Questions
metadata.source: PIB Press Releases - Ministry of Finance, Agriculture, Corporate Affairs

questions.question: What was the Ways and Means Advances (WMA) limit fixed by the Reserve Bank of India for the second half of FY 2025-26?
questions.explanation: According to the Government's borrowing plan for H2 of FY 2025-26, the Reserve Bank of India fixed the Ways and Mean Advances (WMA) limit at ₹50,000 crore to manage temporary mismatches in Government payments and receipts.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In September 2025, the Government of India and the Asian Development Bank (ADB) signed a loan agreement of what amount to promote sustainable and climate-resilient tourism in Uttarakhand?
questions.explanation: The Asian Development Bank (ADB) and the Government of India signed a $126.42 million loan agreement to promote rural development through sustainable and climate-resilient tourism in the Tehri Lake region of Uttarakhand.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: As of July 2025, the Atal Pension Yojana (APY), a flagship social security scheme, surpassed how many gross enrolments since its launch?
questions.explanation: The Atal Pension Yojana (APY) achieved a significant milestone by surpassing 8 crore total gross enrolments as of July 2025, with 39 lakh new subscribers added in the current Financial Year (FY 2025-26) alone.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the total financial outlay approved for the 'Namo Drone Didi' scheme for the period from 2023-24 to 2025-26?
questions.explanation: The 'Namo Drone Didi' scheme has been approved by the Government as a Central Sector Scheme with an outlay of Rs. 1261 Crores for the period from 2023-24 to 2025-26.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Agriculture
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Centre for Processing Accelerated Corporate Exit (C-PACE) was made operational from which date for centralized processing of voluntary closure of companies?
questions.explanation: The C-PACE (Centre for Processing Accelerated Corporate Exit) was made operational with effect from 1st May 2023 for centralized and transparent processing of matters related to the voluntary closure of companies.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Corporate Affairs
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: On October 1, 2025, the Union Government released an advance instalment of tax devolution to State Governments amounting to how much?
questions.explanation: To enable States to accelerate capital spending and finance expenditure, the Union Government released an additional tax devolution of ₹1,01,603 crore to State Governments on 1st October, 2025, as one advance instalment.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The total receipts received by the Government of India up to August 2025 amounted to ₹12,82,709 crore, which was what percentage of the corresponding Budget Estimates for 2025-26?
questions.explanation: As per the monthly accounts published in September 2025, the Government received ₹12,82,709 crore up to August 2025, which was 36.7% of the corresponding Budget Estimates for 2025-26.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the Gross Market Borrowing planned by the Government of India for the second half of the fiscal year 2025-26?
questions.explanation: The Government of India, in consultation with the RBI, finalized its borrowing programme for the second half of FY 2025-26 and planned to borrow ₹6.77 lakh crore through dated securities, including ₹10,000 crore via Sovereign Green Bonds.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: As per the recommendations of the 56th GST Council meeting, what is the special de-merit rate proposed for a select few goods and services under the new citizen-friendly 'Simple Tax' structure?
questions.explanation: The 56th GST Council meeting recommended rationalising the tax rate structure into a 2-rate structure with a Standard Rate of 18% and a Merit Rate of 5%, along with a special de-merit rate of 40% for a select few goods and services.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In September 2025, the Japanese credit rating agency, Rating and Investment Information, Inc. (R&I), upgraded India’s long-term sovereign credit rating to what level?
questions.explanation: Rating and Investment Information, Inc. (R&I) of Japan upgraded India’s long-term sovereign credit rating to ‘BBB+’ from ‘BBB’, while retaining the “Stable” Outlook for the Indian economy.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the official theme of the Swachhata Hi Seva (SHS) Campaign 2025, launched by the Department of Financial Services?
questions.explanation: The Department of Financial Services launched Swachhata Hi Seva 2025 (SHS 2025), a nationwide cleanliness campaign scheduled from September 17 to October 2, 2025. This year's theme is 'Swachhotsav', blending festive celebrations with cleanliness.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The provisional registration for biostimulant products under the Fertilizer Control Order, 1985, became invalid from which date, after the government decided not to grant any further extensions?
questions.explanation: The Government decided not to give any further extension to the provisional registration for biostimulant products beyond 16.06.2025. Accordingly, the Provisional Registration for biostimulants stood invalid since 17.06.2025.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Agriculture
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: As of March 31, 2025, what was the total amount realized by creditors from the 1,194 companies successfully resolved under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC) framework?
questions.explanation: As of March 31, 2025, a total of 1,194 companies have been successfully resolved under the IBC framework, through which creditors have realised an amount of ₹3.89 lakh crore.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Corporate Affairs
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) conducted a series of crackdowns on drug trafficking syndicates under which pan-India operation code-name?
questions.explanation: As part of the ongoing pan-India 'Operation Weed Out', the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) has continued its crackdown on drug trafficking syndicates, making several seizures of hydroponic weed across the country.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: As per the government's borrowing programme for H2 of FY 2025-26, what percentage of the total market borrowing is planned to be raised through 10-year securities?
questions.explanation: The government's borrowing plan for H2 FY 2025-26 specifies the share of borrowing under different maturities. The share for 10-year securities is set at 28.4% of the total borrowing.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Consider the following GST rate changes recommended by the 56th GST Council meeting: I. GST on all individual life and health insurance policies was exempted. II. GST on cement was reduced from 28% to 18%. III. GST on manmade fibre was reduced from 18% to 12% to correct the inverted duty structure. Which of the above statements is/are correct?
questions.explanation: Statements I and II are correct. The 56th GST Council recommended exempting GST on all individual life and health insurance policies and reducing the GST on cement from 28% to 18%. Statement III is incorrect as the GST rate on manmade fibre was reduced from 18% to 5%, not 12%.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Which of the following was NOT among the key provisions of the Banking Laws (Amendment) Act, 2025, that came into effect from August 1, 2025?

options.A: Redefining the threshold of 'substantial interest' from ₹5 lakh to ₹2 crore.
options.B: Increasing the maximum tenure for directors in cooperative banks from 8 years to 10 years.
options.C: Permitting PSBs to transfer unclaimed amounts to the Investor Education and Protection Fund (IEPF).
options.D: Mandating PSBs to offer performance-linked incentives to statutory auditors.
options.E: Empowering PSBs to offer remuneration to statutory auditors.

questions.explanation: The amendments empowered PSBs to offer remuneration to statutory auditors to engage high-quality professionals. However, the press release does not mention a mandate for offering 'performance-linked incentives', making this statement incorrect. The other options are explicitly mentioned as key provisions.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Prime Minister Dhan-Dhaanya Krishi Yojana (PMDDKY), approved in July 2025 for a period of six years, will be implemented through the convergence of how many existing schemes across how many Departments?
questions.explanation: The Prime Minister Dhan-Dhaanya Krishi Yojana aims to enhance agricultural productivity and will be implemented through the convergence of 36 existing schemes across 11 Departments, along with other State schemes and private partnerships.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Agriculture
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: According to the mid-term evaluation of the Agriculture Infrastructure Fund (AIF) by AERC, Pune in December 2023, what percentage of the AIF units had also availed other government subsidies, highlighting successful scheme convergence?
questions.explanation: The mid-term evaluation of the AIF scheme highlighted its positive impact and noted that 31% of the AIF units had also availed other government subsidies, demonstrating beneficial convergence with other schemes.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Agriculture
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Ministry of Corporate Affairs amended the Companies (Compromises, Arrangements and Amalgamations) Rules in September 2025 to expand the scope of fast track mergers. Which of the following merger scenarios is NOT permitted under this new expanded scope?

options.A: Between two or more unlisted companies meeting prescribed loan thresholds.
options.B: Between a holding company and its subsidiary where the transferor company is a listed company.
options.C: Between two or more subsidiaries of the same holding company where the transferor is unlisted.
options.D: Between a holding company and its subsidiaries where the transferor company is unlisted.
options.E: All of the above are permitted.

questions.explanation: The amendment on September 4th, 2025, included mergers between a holding company and subsidiary companies but explicitly excluded cases where the transferor company is a listed company. Therefore, a merger where the transferor is a listed company is not permitted under the fast track procedure.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Corporate Affairs
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the Ways and Mean Advances (WMA) limit fixed by the Reserve Bank of India for the second half of FY 2025-26?
questions.explanation: According to the press release on the Government’s Borrowing plan, the Reserve Bank of India has fixed the Ways and Mean Advances (WMA) limit for H2 of FY 2025-26 at ₹50,000 crore to take care of temporary mismatches in Government payments and receipts.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Japanese credit rating agency, Rating and Investment Information, Inc. (R&I), upgraded India’s long-term sovereign credit rating to what level in September 2025?
questions.explanation: In September 2025, the Japanese credit rating agency Rating and Investment Information, Inc. (R&I) upgraded India’s long-term sovereign credit rating to ‘BBB+’ from ‘BBB’, while retaining the “Stable” Outlook.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the total outlay approved for the 'Namo Drone Didi' scheme for the period from 2023-24 to 2025-26?
questions.explanation: The 'Namo Drone Didi' has been approved as a Central Sector Scheme for providing drones to Women Self Help Groups (SHGs) with a total outlay of Rs. 1261 Crores for the period from 2023-24 to 2025-26.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Agriculture
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Atal Pension Yojana (APY) surpassed how many gross enrolments as of July 2025?
questions.explanation: The Atal Pension Yojana (APY) achieved a significant milestone by surpassing 8 crore total gross enrolments as of July 2025, with an addition of 39 lakh new subscribers in the current Financial Year (FY 2025-26) alone.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Government of India and ADB signed a $125 million loan agreement in September 2025 to upgrade urban services in which Indian state?
questions.explanation: The Government of India and the Asian Development Bank (ADB) signed a $125 million loan agreement to enhance urban livability and bolster climate resilience in six district headquarters and Guwahati, in the State of Assam.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Under the 'Swachhata Hi Seva (SHS) Campaign 2025', what is the theme for this year's nationwide cleanliness campaign?
questions.explanation: The Department of Financial Services (DFS), Ministry of Finance has launched Swachhata Hi Seva 2025 (SHS 2025). This year's theme is 'Swachhotsav', which blends the spirit of festive celebrations with the responsibility of cleanliness.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What amount of Gross Market Borrowing does the Government of India plan for the second half of FY 2025-26, including issuance of Sovereign Green Bonds?
questions.explanation: The Government of India plans to borrow ₹6.77 lakh crore in the second half of the fiscal year 2025-26 (H2: FY 2025-26) through dated securities, which includes ₹10,000 crore through the issuance of Sovereign Green Bonds (SGrBs).
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: According to the 56th GST Council meeting recommendations, what is the new proposed GST rate for Cement?
questions.explanation: The 56th GST Council meeting recommended a reduction of GST on Cement from 28% to 18%, as part of its rate rationalisation measures.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Banking Laws (Amendment) Act, 2025, which came into effect from August 1, 2025, redefined the threshold of 'substantial interest' from ₹5 lakh to what new amount?
questions.explanation: One of the key amendments in the Banking Laws (Amendment) Act, 2025, is redefining the threshold of ‘substantial interest’ from ₹5 lakh to ₹2 crore, revising a limit that had remained unchanged since 1968.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Government of India received Tax Revenue (Net to Centre) of ₹8,10,407 crore upto August 2025. How much was transferred to State Governments as Devolution of Share of Taxes during the same period?
questions.explanation: As per the monthly accounts of the Government of India up to August 2025, ₹5,30,148 crore has been transferred to State Governments as Devolution of Share of Taxes by the Government of India during this period.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: As per the press release on the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC), what amount had been realised by creditors from the 1,194 companies successfully resolved as of March 31, 2025?
questions.explanation: As of March 31, 2025, a total of 1,194 companies have been successfully resolved under the IBC framework. Through these cases, creditors have realised an amount of ₹3.89 lakh crore.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Corporate Affairs
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Investor Education and Protection Fund Authority (IEPFA) launched a 100-day campaign from July to November 2025. What is the name of this campaign?
questions.explanation: The Investor Education and Protection Fund Authority (IEPFA) launched a 100-day campaign titled “Saksham Niveshak”, running from 28th July to 6th November 2025, aimed at empowering shareholders by creating awareness about unclaimed dividends.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Corporate Affairs
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Union Cabinet approved the 'Prime Minister Dhan-Dhaanya Krishi Yojana' in July 2025. The scheme will be implemented in 100 districts through the convergence of how many existing schemes?
questions.explanation: The Prime Minister Dhan-Dhaanya Krishi Yojana will be implemented through convergence of 36 existing schemes across 11 Departments, other State schemes and local partnerships with the private sector.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Agriculture
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the timeline set by the 56th GST Council for the Goods and Services Tax Appellate Tribunal (GSTAT) to commence hearings?
questions.explanation: The 56th GST Council recommended the operationalisation of the Goods and Services Tax Appellate Tribunal (GSTAT) for accepting appeals before the end of September and to commence hearings before the end of December 2025.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The government extended the provisional registration for biostimulant products multiple times. What is the final deadline beyond which no further extensions will be granted for provisional registration?
questions.explanation: The provisional registration for biostimulants was extended multiple times, with the latest extension until 16th June, 2025. The Government has decided not to give any further extension to the provisional registration for biostimulant products beyond 16.06.2025.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Agriculture
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: As per the government's borrowing plan for H2 FY 2025-26, which maturity of securities will have the highest share of borrowing?
questions.explanation: The press release on the borrowing plan for H2 FY 2025-26 specifies the share of borrowing under different maturities. The 10-year securities have the highest allocation with a share of 28.4%.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Which of the following statements about the recommendations from the 56th GST Council meeting is INCORRECT?

options.A: GST on all individual life and health insurance policies is to be exempted.
options.B: The GST rate on manmade fibre is to be reduced from 18% to 5%.
options.C: A uniform GST rate of 18% is proposed for all auto parts irrespective of their HS code.
options.D: GST on small cars and motorcycles equal to or below 350cc is reduced from 28% to 18%.
options.E: The 4-tiered tax rate structure is rationalised into a 3-rate structure with rates of 5%, 18%, and 28%.

questions.explanation: The GST Council recommended rationalising the 4-tiered tax rate structure into a citizen-friendly ‘Simple Tax’ - a 2-rate structure with a Standard Rate of 18% and a Merit Rate of 5%, plus a special de-merit rate of 40%. The statement about a 3-rate structure of 5%, 18%, and 28% is incorrect.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Considering the PSB Manthan 2025 discussions, which of the following areas was NOT highlighted as a key focus for Public Sector Banks to enable sunrise sectors?

options.E: Supporting Indian enterprises overseas to become globally competitive

questions.explanation: The PSB Manthan 2025 deliberations emphasized that PSBs must emerge as key enablers of sunrise sectors such as renewable energy, electric mobility, green hydrogen, semiconductors, shipbuilding, and digital industries. Traditional textile manufacturing was not mentioned as a sunrise sector in this specific context.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Under the Companies (Compromises, Arrangements and Amalgamations) Rules, which new class of companies was enabled for fast-track merger procedure through the amendment on 4th September, 2025?

options.B: A holding company and its subsidiary where the transferor is a listed company
options.C: Any two or more Section 8 companies
options.D: Two or more unlisted companies which meet prescribed thresholds of outstanding loans, debentures or deposits
options.E: A foreign company merging with an unrelated Indian company

questions.explanation: The CAA Rules were amended on 4th September, 2025, to include additional classes for fast-track merger. One of these new classes is 'Two or more unlisted companies (other than section 8 companies) which meet prescribed thresholds of outstanding loans, debentures or deposits'.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Corporate Affairs
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The weekly borrowing through Treasury Bills in Q3 of FY 2025-26 was expected to be ₹19,000 crore. What is the correct breakdown of this amount across 91 DTBs, 182 DTBs, and 364 DTBs respectively?
questions.explanation: The press release states that the weekly borrowing through issuance of Treasury Bills in Q3 of FY 2025-26 is expected to be ₹19,000 crore with an issuance of ₹7,000 crore under 91 DTBs, ₹6,000 crore under 182 DTBs and ₹6,000 crore under 364 DTBs, respectively.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In September 2025, the Japanese credit rating agency R&I upgraded India's long-term sovereign credit rating to what level, while retaining a 'Stable' outlook?
questions.explanation: Rating and Investment Information, Inc. (R&I) upgraded India’s long-term sovereign credit rating to ‘BBB+’ from ‘BBB’, while retaining the “Stable” Outlook for the Indian economy. This was the third such upgrade in 2025.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the Ways and Means Advances (WMA) limit fixed by the Reserve Bank of India for the Government of India for the second half of FY 2025-26?
questions.explanation: To manage temporary mismatches in Government payments and receipts, the Reserve Bank of India fixed the Ways and Mean Advances (WMA) limit for H2 of FY 2025-26 at ₹50,000 crore.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Government of India and the Asian Development Bank (ADB) signed a loan agreement of what amount in September 2025 to upgrade urban services in Assam?
questions.explanation: The Government of India and the ADB signed a $125 million loan agreement to enhance urban livability and bolster climate resilience in six district headquarters and Guwahati, in the State of Assam.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Atal Pension Yojana (APY) surpassed how many gross enrolments as a major milestone celebrated on its 10th anniversary in July 2025?
questions.explanation: The Atal Pension Yojana (APY), a flagship social security scheme, achieved a significant milestone by surpassing 8 crore total gross enrolments, as announced in a press release dated July 25, 2025.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the total outlay approved for the 'Namo Drone Didi' scheme for the period 2023-24 to 2025-26?
questions.explanation: The 'Namo Drone Didi' scheme was approved as a Central Sector Scheme with an outlay of Rs. 1261 Crores for the period from 2023-24 to 2025-26, aiming to provide 15,000 drones to Women Self Help Groups.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Agriculture
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: According to the IBC data released in August 2025, how many companies have been successfully resolved under the framework as of March 31, 2025?
questions.explanation: As of March 31, 2025, a total of 1,194 companies have been successfully resolved under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC) framework, enabling creditors to realize an amount of ₹3.89 lakh crore.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Corporate Affairs
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Government of India plans to borrow how much through dated securities in the second half of the fiscal year 2025-26 (H2: FY 2025-26)?
questions.explanation: The Government of India finalized its borrowing programme for H2 of FY 2025-26 and plans to borrow ₹6.77 lakh crore through dated securities, which includes ₹10,000 crore via Sovereign Green Bonds (SGrBs).
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the theme of the Swachhata Hi Seva 2025 (SHS 2025) campaign launched by the Department of Financial Services, scheduled from September 17 to October 2, 2025?
questions.explanation: The Department of Financial Services launched Swachhata Hi Seva 2025 with the theme 'Swachhotsav', which blends the spirit of festive celebrations with the responsibility of cleanliness.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Union Cabinet approved the 'Prime Minister Dhan-Dhaanya Krishi Yojana' in July 2025. What is the primary objective of this scheme?

options.A: To provide direct income support to all farmers
options.B: To double the export of agricultural products within six years
options.C: To enhance agricultural productivity and improve infrastructure in 100 selected districts
options.D: To promote only organic farming across the country
options.E: To waive all agricultural loans for small and marginal farmers

questions.explanation: Approved for six years starting 2025-26, the PM Dhan-Dhaanya Krishi Yojana aims to enhance agricultural productivity, promote crop diversification, augment post-harvest storage, and improve credit facilities in 100 selected districts.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Agriculture
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: As per the monthly accounts published in September 2025, the Total Expenditure incurred by the Government of India up to August 2025 was what percentage of the corresponding Budget Estimate (BE) 2025-26?
questions.explanation: The monthly accounts for August 2025 showed that the Total Expenditure incurred by the Government was ₹18,80,862 crore, which is 37.1% of the corresponding Budget Estimate for 2025-26.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Under the regulations for biostimulants, the provisional registration for existing products, which was extended multiple times, finally stood invalid from which date in 2025?
questions.explanation: The government provided multiple extensions for provisional registration of biostimulants but decided not to give any further extension beyond June 16, 2025. Accordingly, the provisional registration stood invalid from June 17, 2025.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Agriculture
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: How much amount did the Union Government release to State Governments on October 1, 2025, as one advance instalment of tax devolution to accelerate capital spending during the festive season?
questions.explanation: To enable States to accelerate capital spending and finance development expenditure during the festive season, the Union Government released an additional tax devolution of ₹1,01,603 crore to State Governments on October 1, 2025.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The 'Saksham Niveshak' campaign, launched by IEPFA in July 2025, is a 100-day national drive focused on which key objectives?

options.A: Promoting new investments in the stock market
options.B: Facilitating resolution of unclaimed dividends and supporting KYC/nomination updates for shareholders
options.D: Providing a platform for startups to raise funds from retail investors
options.E: Offering free financial advisory services to senior citizens

questions.explanation: The 'Saksham Niveshak' campaign (July 28 – November 6, 2025) was launched by IEPFA to empower shareholders by creating awareness about unclaimed dividends, and guiding them to update their KYC and nomination details to reclaim their rightful dues.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Corporate Affairs
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The government's novel AI-based weather forecasting program for agriculture, launched in 2025, reached 3.8 crore farmers by blending which two open-access models?

options.A: IBM's GRAF and The Weather Company's Model
options.C: Google’s Neural GCM and ECMWF’s Artificial Intelligence Forecasting Systems (AIFS)
options.D: IMD's Param and NCMRWF's Unified Model
options.E: Microsoft's ClimaCell and ISRO's INSAT Model

questions.explanation: The forecasts used by the Ministry of Agriculture were a blend of two open-access models: Google’s Neural GCM and ECMWF’s Artificial Intelligence Forecasting Systems (AIFS), which outperformed other available forecasts at predicting the monsoon locally.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Agriculture
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question:
Which of the following statements about the recommendations of the 56th GST Council meeting held in September 2025 is/are correct? 
I. It proposed a simplified 2-rate structure with a Standard Rate of 18% and a Merit Rate of 5%. 
II. GST on cement was reduced from 28% to 18%. 
III. GST on all individual life and health insurance policies was exempted to make insurance more affordable. 
IV. The de-merit rate for select goods and services was proposed to be 30%.

options.E: All I, II, III and IV

questions.explanation: The 56th GST Council approved major reforms including a 2-rate structure (18% standard, 5% merit), reduction of GST on cement from 28% to 18%, and exemption of GST on all individual life and health insurance policies. The special de-merit rate was proposed at 40%, not 30%, making statement IV incorrect.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: As per the amendments to the Companies (Compromises, Arrangements and Amalgamations) Rules in September 2025, which of the following class of companies was NOT included to avail the fast-track merger procedure?

options.A: Two or more subsidiaries of the same holding company where the transferor is not a listed company.
options.B: Two or more unlisted companies which meet prescribed thresholds of outstanding loans.
options.C: A holding company and its subsidiary companies where the transferor is a listed company.
options.D: Holding company and subsidiary companies, excluding cases where the transferor company is a listed company.

questions.explanation: The amendment in September 2025 widened the scope of fast-track mergers to include several classes, but specifically excluded cases where the transferor company is a listed company in mergers between holding and subsidiary companies. Mergers between two or more start-ups were already included in a 2021 amendment.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Corporate Affairs
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Identify the correct set of provisions from the Banking Laws (Amendment) Act, 2025, which came into effect from August 1, 2025.

options.A: Redefinition of 'substantial interest' threshold to ₹50 lakh, increasing director tenures in cooperative banks to 12 years, and allowing PSBs to transfer unclaimed shares to IEPF.
options.B: Redefinition of 'substantial interest' threshold to ₹2 crore, increasing director tenures in cooperative banks to 10 years, and allowing PSBs to transfer unclaimed shares to IEPF.
options.C: Mandatory merger of all cooperative banks with PSBs, redefining 'substantial interest' to ₹1 crore, and setting director tenures to 8 years.
options.D: Redefinition of 'substantial interest' threshold to ₹2 crore, decreasing director tenures in cooperative banks to 6 years, and disallowing transfer of unclaimed shares to IEPF.
options.E: Increasing director tenures in cooperative banks to 10 years, allowing PSBs to set their own 'substantial interest' thresholds, and mandatory transfer of unclaimed shares to the RBI.

questions.explanation: Key provisions of the Banking Laws (Amendment) Act, 2025, effective from August 1, 2025, include redefining the 'substantial interest' threshold from ₹5 lakh to ₹2 crore, increasing the maximum tenure of cooperative bank directors to 10 years, and permitting PSBs to transfer unclaimed shares, interest, and bond amounts to the Investor Education and Protection Fund (IEPF).
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Which statement is INCORRECT regarding the government's borrowing programme for H2 of FY 2025-26 as announced in September 2025?

options.A: The gross market borrowing is planned at ₹6.77 lakh crore through 22 weekly auctions.
options.B: The borrowing includes ₹10,000 crore through the issuance of Sovereign Green Bonds (SGrBs).
options.C: The largest share of borrowing (28.4%) will be under the 10-year security maturity.
options.D: Weekly borrowing through Treasury Bills in Q3 is expected to be ₹19,000 crore for 13 weeks.
options.E: The government reserves the right to exercise a greenshoe option of up to ₹5,000 crore against each security.

questions.explanation: All statements are correct except for the greenshoe option amount. The government will reserve the right to exercise a greenshoe option to retain an additional subscription of up to ₹2,000 crore, not ₹5,000 crore, against each of the securities indicated.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Based on the mid-term evaluation of the Agriculture Infrastructure Fund (AIF) scheme reported in August 2025, which of the following findings is inaccurate?

options.A: Approximately 85% of total units cited the availability of an AIF loan as the primary reason for starting their unit.
options.B: The total capacity created by sample AIF warehouses, cold storages, and silos was around 879 thousand MT.
options.C: About 54% of respondents believed that farmers' incomes increased due to AIF units.
options.D: On average, the AIF loan covered about 75% of the project cost for the units.
options.E: Around 70% of the units have taken loans for creating new infrastructure.

questions.explanation: The mid-term evaluation by AERC, Pune found that on average, about 40% of the project cost of the AIF units was covered by the AIF loan, not 75%. All other statements accurately reflect the findings of the evaluation.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Agriculture
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Digital Agriculture Mission, approved in September 2024, is built on three foundational registries or databases that form the 'AgriStack'. Which of the following correctly identifies these three core components?

options.A: Farmer Registry, Krishi Decision Support System (KDSS), and Soil Health Card Database
options.B: Geo-Referenced Village Maps, Crop Sown Registry, and the Farmers Registry
options.C: PM-KISAN Beneficiary List, e-NAM Mandi Registry, and National Crop Insurance Portal Data
options.D: Soil Fertility & Profile Map, Farmer Registry, and a Real-time Weather Database
options.E: Crop Sown Registry, Livestock Census Data, and Geo-Referenced Village Maps

questions.explanation: The AgriStack Digital Public Infrastructure (DPI), a core part of the Digital Agriculture Mission, consists of three foundational registries: Geo-Referenced Village Maps, Crop Sown Registry, and the Farmers Registry, which are all created and maintained by the State Governments/Union Territories.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Agriculture
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the Ways and Mean Advances (WMA) limit fixed by the Reserve Bank of India for the second half of FY 2025-26 to manage temporary mismatches in Government payments and receipts?
questions.explanation: According to the press release on the Government's borrowing plan, the Reserve Bank of India has fixed the Ways and Mean Advances (WMA) limit for H2 of FY 2025-26 at ₹50,000 crore.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Atal Pension Yojana (APY), a flagship social security scheme, surpassed how many gross enrolments as of July 2025?
questions.explanation: As per the press release from the Ministry of Finance, the Atal Pension Yojana (APY) achieved a significant milestone by surpassing 8 crore total gross enrolments as of July 2025.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In a significant diplomatic and economic development in September 2025, India signed a Bilateral Investment Agreement (BIA) with which country?
questions.explanation: The Government of the Republic of India and the Government of the State of Israel signed a Bilateral Investment Agreement (BIA) in New Delhi on 8th September 2025.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What is the theme for the Swachhata Hi Seva 2025 campaign, launched by the Department of Financial Services and scheduled from September 17 to October 2, 2025?
questions.explanation: The Department of Financial Services (DFS), Ministry of Finance, launched the Swachhata Hi Seva 2025 campaign with the theme 'Swachhotsav', which blends the spirit of festive celebrations with the responsibility of cleanliness.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: According to data released in July 2025, the Gross Non-Performing Assets (NPAs) of public sector banks have shown a significant decline, reducing to what percentage as of March 2025?
questions.explanation: A press release from the Ministry of Finance stated that the Gross Non-Performing Assets (NPAs) of public sector banks have reduced from 9.11% in March 2021 to 2.58% as of March 2025.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In October 2025, how much additional tax devolution was released by the Union Government to State Governments to enable them to accelerate capital spending ahead of the festive season?
questions.explanation: On 1st October 2025, the Union Government released an additional tax devolution of ₹1,01,603 crore to State Governments to accelerate capital spending and finance development expenditure.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: According to the monthly accounts published in September 2025, the Total Expenditure incurred by the Government of India up to August 2025 was ₹18,80,862 crore, which represented what percentage of the corresponding Budget Estimates (BE) 2025-26?
questions.explanation: As per the monthly accounts data released on 30th September 2025, the Total Expenditure incurred by the Government of India was ₹18,80,862 crore, which is 37.1% of the corresponding Budget Estimates for 2025-26.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Government of India and the Asian Development Bank (ADB) signed a $125 million loan agreement in September 2025 to enhance urban livability and bolster climate resilience in which state?
questions.explanation: A loan agreement for $125 million was signed between the Government of India and the ADB to enhance urban services in six district headquarters and Guwahati, in the State of Assam.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The key provisions of the Banking Laws (Amendment) Act, 2025, which came into effect from 1st August 2025, redefined the threshold of 'substantial interest' from ₹5 lakh to what new amount?
questions.explanation: One of the key amendments in the Banking Laws (Amendment) Act, 2025, is redefining the threshold of 'substantial interest' from ₹5 lakh to ₹2 crore, revising a limit that had been unchanged since 1968.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: Which Japanese credit rating agency upgraded India’s long-term sovereign credit rating to ‘BBB+’ with a “Stable” outlook in September 2025?
questions.explanation: The press release dated 19th September 2025 announced that the Japanese credit rating agency, Rating and Investment Information, Inc. (R&I), upgraded India’s long-term sovereign credit rating to ‘BBB+’ from ‘BBB’.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Investor Education and Protection Fund Authority (IEPFA) launched a 100-day national campaign from 28th July to 6th November 2025, aimed at shareholder awareness for reclaiming dividends. What is the name of this campaign?
questions.explanation: The IEPFA launched a 100-day campaign titled “Saksham Niveshak”, running from 28th July to 6th November 2025, to empower shareholders by creating awareness about unclaimed dividends.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Corporate Affairs
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Union Cabinet approved the Prime Minister Dhan-Dhaanya Krishi Yojana in July 2025 for a period of six years. How many districts will be covered under this scheme?
questions.explanation: The Union Cabinet approved the “Prime Minister Dhan-Dhaanya Krishi Yojana” on 16th July 2025, for a period of six years, beginning with 2025-26 to cover 100 districts, inspired by NITI Aayog’s Aspirational District Programme.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Agriculture
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: As per the government's borrowing plan for the second half of FY 2025-26, what is the total amount planned to be borrowed through the issuance of Sovereign Green Bonds (SGrBs)?
questions.explanation: The Government of India's borrowing programme for H2 of FY 2025-26 includes a plan to borrow ₹6.77 lakh crore through dated securities, which includes ₹10,000 crore through the issuance of Sovereign Green Bonds (SGrBs).
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: As a result of the Government's RRB consolidation drive under the 'One State-One RRB' policy, the number of Regional Rural Banks was reduced from 43 to how many, effective from 1st May 2025?
questions.explanation: Guided by the principle of 'One State-One RRB', the Government continued the consolidation process, reducing the number of RRBs from 43 to 28 with effect from 1st May 2025.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: As per the government's borrowing programme for H2 of FY 2025-26, what was the expected weekly borrowing through the issuance of Treasury Bills in the third quarter (Q3) of the fiscal year?
questions.explanation: The borrowing plan for H2 of FY 2025-26 specified that the weekly borrowing through issuance of Treasury Bills in the third quarter (Q3) was expected to be ₹19,000 crore for 13 weeks.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The 56th GST Council meeting recommended several rate rationalisations. Which of the following statements about these recommendations is INCORRECT?

options.A: GST on Cement was reduced from 28% to 18%.
options.B: GST on manmade fibre was reduced from 18% to 5%.
options.C: GST on Small Cars and Motorcycles (<=350cc) was reduced from 28% to 18%.
options.D: GST on Hotel Accommodation services with value <= Rs. 7,500 was reduced from 12% to NIL.
options.E: GST on all individual life insurance policies was exempted.

questions.explanation: The 56th GST Council recommended reducing GST from 12% to 5% on “Hotel Accommodation” services having a value less than or equal to Rs. 7,500 per unit per day. It was not reduced to NIL.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question:
Consider the following statements regarding the performance of the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC) as of March 31, 2025: 
I. A total of 1,194 companies have been successfully resolved. 
II. Creditors have realised ₹3.89 lakh crore through these resolutions. 
III. The realised amount is over 170% of the liquidation value of these companies. 
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
questions.explanation: All three statements are correct as per the press release. As of March 31, 2025, 1,194 companies were resolved, creditors realised ₹3.89 lakh crore, and this amount was over 170% of the liquidation value of these companies.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Corporate Affairs
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The "Namo Drone Didi" scheme, with an outlay of ₹1261 Crores for 2023-24 to 2025-26, aims to provide 15,000 drones to Women Self Help Groups (SHGs). What is the percentage of the drone package cost provided as Central Financial Assistance (CFA) to the SHGs?
questions.explanation: Under the 'Namo Drone Didi' scheme, Central Financial Assistance (CFA) is provided at the rate of 80% of the cost of the drone package, up to a maximum of Rs. 8.00 lakhs, to the selected women SHGs.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Agriculture
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Ministry of Corporate Affairs amended the Companies (Compromises, Arrangements and Amalgamations) Rules, 2016 in September 2025 to widen the scope of fast-track mergers. Which of the following classes of companies was explicitly excluded from the newly added provisions for holding and subsidiary company mergers?

options.A: Cases where the subsidiary is a listed company.
options.B: Cases where the transferor company is a listed company.
options.C: Cases where the holding company is unlisted.

questions.explanation: The amendment on 4th September 2025 expanded fast-track mergers to include holding and subsidiary companies but explicitly excluded cases where the transferor company is a listed company.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Corporate Affairs
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Digital Agriculture Mission, approved in September 2024, envisages creating a Digital Public Infrastructure (DPI) for Agriculture. Which of the following is NOT one of the three foundational registries of the AgriStack DPI mentioned in the press release?

options.E: All of the above are foundational registries

questions.explanation: The press release states that the AgriStack DPI consists of three foundational registries: Geo-Referenced Village Maps, Crop Sown Registry, and the Farmers Registry. The Soil Health Card Database, while part of the broader digital agriculture ecosystem, is not listed as one of these three foundational registries of AgriStack.

questions.question: To promote ease of doing business, zero fee is now charged for the incorporation of all companies with an authorized capital up to what amount?
questions.explanation: As part of initiatives to ensure quick registration of companies, a zero fee is now charged for the incorporation of all companies with an authorized capital up to Rs. 15 lakh or with up to 20 members where no share capital is applicable.

questions.explanation: A press release from the Ministry of Finance stated that Gross Non-Performing Assets (NPAs) of public sector banks have been declining, reducing from 9.11% in March 2021 to 2.58% in March 2025.

questions.explanation: A key amendment in the Banking Laws (Amendment) Act, 2025, which came into effect from 1st August 2025, was to redefine the threshold of ‘substantial interest’ from ₹5 lakh to ₹2 crore, revising a limit that had remained unchanged since 1968.

questions.explanation: The Union Cabinet approved the Research Development and Innovation (RDI) Scheme with a corpus of Rs. One lakh Crore to provide long-term financing at low or nil interest rates to encourage private sector investment in RDI.

questions.explanation: According to the data released in August 2025, as of March 31, 2025, creditors have realised an amount of ₹3.89 lakh crore through the successful resolution of 1,194 companies under the IBC.

questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: The Prime Minister Dhan-Dhaanya Krishi Yojana (PMDDKY), approved in July 2025, aims to enhance agricultural productivity in 100 districts. How will this scheme be implemented in terms of integrating existing schemes?

options.A: Through a new standalone framework with its own budget.
options.B: Through convergence of 11 existing schemes across 36 Departments.
options.C: Through convergence of 36 existing schemes across 11 Departments.
options.D: By subsuming 100 existing schemes under a single umbrella.
options.E: Through partnerships with private sector only.

questions.explanation: The Prime Minister Dhan-Dhaanya Krishi Yojana (PMDDKY) will be implemented through the convergence of 36 existing schemes across 11 Departments, along with other State schemes and local partnerships with the private sector.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Agriculture
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question:
Based on the 56th GST Council meeting recommendations, which of the following statements is/are correct? 
I. GST on all individual life and health insurance policies has been exempted. 
II. The inverted duty structure for the fertilizer sector was corrected by reducing GST on Sulphuric acid from 18% to 5%. 
III. GST on buses, trucks, and ambulances was reduced from 28% to 18%.
questions.explanation: All three statements are correct. The 56th GST Council meeting exempted GST on individual life and health insurance, corrected the inverted duty structure on inputs for fertilizers like Sulphuric acid by reducing the rate to 5%, and reduced the GST on commercial vehicles like buses and trucks to 18%.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: According to the Government's borrowing plan for H2 of FY 2025-26, what is the combined share of borrowing allocated to securities with a maturity of 30 years or more?
questions.explanation: The borrowing plan specifies the share under different maturities: 30-year (9.2%), 40-year (11.1%), and 50-year (9.2%). The combined share for securities with a maturity of 30 years or more is the sum of these, which is 9.2% + 11.1% + 9.2% = 29.5%.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question:
Consider the following statements about India's sovereign rating upgrades in 2025: 
I. S&P Global Ratings upgraded India's long-term rating to 'BBB' from 'BBB-' in August 2025. 
II. Japan's R&I upgraded the rating to 'BBB+' while changing the outlook from 'Stable' to 'Positive'. 
III. Morningstar DBRS was the first among the three to upgrade India's rating in May 2025. 
Which of the above statements is/are correct?
questions.explanation: Statement I is correct; S&P upgraded India to 'BBB' in August 2025. Statement II is incorrect; R&I upgraded the rating to 'BBB+' but retained the 'Stable' outlook, it did not change it to 'Positive'. Statement III is correct; Morningstar DBRS's upgrade was in May 2025, which was before S&P's (August) and R&I's (September). Therefore, statements I and III are correct.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: In order to regulate biostimulants under the Fertilizer Control Order (FCO), 1985, the Government has mandated that all provisional registrations issued for such products will stand invalid after which date?
questions.explanation: The Government provided several extensions for the provisional registration of biostimulants but decided not to give any further extension beyond 16.06.2025. Accordingly, the Provisional Registration for biostimulant products stood invalid from 17.06.2025.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Agriculture
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question:
As per the monthly accounts of the Government of India published in September 2025, which of the following figures for the period up to August 2025 is correctly matched? 
I. Total Receipts as a percentage of BE 2025-26: 36.7% 
II. Total Expenditure as a percentage of BE 2025-26: 30.9% 
III. Capital Account Expenditure: ₹4,31,579 crore
questions.explanation: Statement I is correct: Total Receipts were ₹12,82,709 crore, which is 36.7% of BE 2025-26. Statement II is incorrect: Total Expenditure was ₹18,80,862 crore, which is 37.1% of BE 2025-26 (the 30.9% figure was for the period upto July 2025). Statement III is correct: Capital Account Expenditure was ₹4,31,579 crore. Thus, I and III are correct.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question: What was the Ways and Mean Advances (WMA) limit fixed by the Reserve Bank of India for the Government of India for the second half of FY 2025-26?
questions.explanation: According to the press release on the Government's Borrowing plan, the Reserve Bank of India has fixed the Ways and Mean Advances (WMA) limit for H2 of FY 2025-26 at ₹50,000 crore to take care of temporary mismatches in Government payments and receipts.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.explanation: The press release dated 19th September 2025 explicitly states that the Japanese credit rating agency, R&I, upgraded India’s long-term sovereign credit rating to ‘BBB+’ from ‘BBB’.

questions.question: For the second half of the fiscal year 2025-26, how much does the Government of India plan to borrow through dated securities, and what amount is allocated for Sovereign Green Bonds (SGrBs) within this borrowing?

options.A: ₹6.50 lakh crore, including ₹15,000 crore through SGrBs
options.B: ₹7.00 lakh crore, including ₹20,000 crore through SGrBs
options.C: ₹6.77 lakh crore, including ₹10,000 crore through SGrBs
options.D: ₹5.77 lakh crore, including ₹10,000 crore through SGrBs
options.E: ₹6.77 lakh crore, including ₹25,000 crore through SGrBs

questions.explanation: As per the press release on the borrowing plan, the Government of India plans to borrow ₹6.77 lakh crore in H2: FY 2025-26 through dated securities, which includes ₹10,000 crore through the issuance of Sovereign Green Bonds (SGrBs).
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance

questions.question: According to the monthly accounts data released in September 2025, what was the Tax Revenue (Net to Centre) received by the Government of India up to the month of August 2025?

questions.question: In September 2025, the Government of India and the Asian Development Bank (ADB) signed a $125 million loan to enhance urban livability in Assam. The project is specifically focused on which key infrastructure developments?

options.A: Construction of rural roads and bridges in all districts
options.B: Development of metro rail systems in district headquarters
options.C: Building new airports and railway stations
options.D: Delivering continuous metered water supply and upgrading stormwater management systems
options.E: Setting up solar power plants and renewable energy grids

questions.explanation: The press release clearly states that the project will benefit residents by 'delivering continuous metered water supply and upgrading stormwater management systems' in six district headquarters and Guwahati.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance

questions.question: What key recommendation was approved by the 56th GST Council in September 2025 regarding individual life insurance and health insurance policies to make them more affordable for citizens?

options.C: Capping the maximum GST amount payable on premiums
options.D: Exemption of GST on all such policies and their reinsurance
options.E: Introducing a special de-merit rate of 40% on high-value policies

questions.explanation: The press release on the 56th GST Council meeting explicitly states the council approved the 'Exemption of GST on all individual life insurance policies' and 'Exemption of GST on all individual health insurance policies' to make insurance more affordable.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question:
With reference to the Banking Laws (Amendment) Act, 2025, which of the following provisions were among those that came into effect from 1st August 2025?
I. Redefining the threshold of ‘substantial interest’ from ₹5 lakh to ₹2 crore.
II. Permitting Public Sector Banks to transfer unclaimed shares and bond redemption amounts to the Investor Education and Protection Fund (IEPF).
III. Increasing the maximum tenure of cooperative bank directors (excluding the chairperson and whole-time director) from 8 years to 10 years.
questions.explanation: The press release on the Banking Laws (Amendment) Act, 2025, explicitly mentions that the provisions which came into force on 1st August 2025 include redefining 'substantial interest' to ₹2 crore, allowing PSBs to transfer unclaimed amounts to the IEPF, and increasing the tenure of cooperative bank directors to 10 years.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question:
Based on the Government's borrowing programme for H2 of FY 2025-26, which of the following statements about the maturity-wise distribution of borrowing is correct?
I. The highest share of borrowing, at 28.4%, is allocated to 10-year securities.
II. The combined share for 30-year and 50-year securities is 18.4%.
III. The share for 3-year securities (6.6%) is exactly half the share of 5-year securities (13.3%).

options.B: Only I and II are correct
options.C: Only II and III are correct
options.D: All I, II, and III are correct
options.E: Only I and III are correct

questions.explanation: Statement I is correct as 10-year securities have the largest share at 28.4%. Statement II is correct as the share for both 30-year and 50-year securities is 9.2%, summing up to 18.4%. Statement III is incorrect because 6.6% is not half of 13.3%. Therefore, only statements I and II are correct.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness

questions.question:
Which of the following accurately reflects the key deliberations that emerged from the PSB Manthan 2025 event for Public Sector Banks (PSBs)?
I. A strong emphasis was placed on moving beyond legacy systems to agile, interoperable platforms and strengthening cyber resilience.
II. Collaboration with fintechs, academia, and global institutions was encouraged to enhance PSB capabilities and accelerate innovation.
III. It was suggested that PSBs should only focus on their traditional strengths in agriculture and MSMEs and avoid emerging sunrise sectors.
questions.explanation: The press release on PSB Manthan 2025 highlights the need for technology modernization (Statement I) and encourages collaboration with fintechs and academia (Statement II). Statement III is incorrect because the release explicitly states that while traditional strengths must be deepened, PSBs must also emerge as key enablers of sunrise sectors like renewable energy and semiconductors.
questions.source_type: PIB Press Release - Ministry of Finance
questions.subject: General_Awareness
